page.title: 16CONOCO TERMINAL
page.content: {THE CONOCO TERMINAL} The Termial was built by the Government in 1956 after the {SUEZ {CRISIS}to provide more stoage space for Oil. CONOCO are just one of the British Pipeline agencies and they transport Oil and Petrol as well as storing it in pipes and tanks. All the pipes that take up room in Conoco in the grounds comes up to 27.5 acres in all. There are 18 oil tankers that service Conoco, as wall as the tanks that hold 10m. gallons (all of the tanks are underground,and are bombproof) of oil or petrol. There are different tanks to store different kinds of oil, petrol and deisel. Each tanker holds 4000 or 6000 gallons depending onits size. There are 50 people working at Conoco. Mr. Kemp the manager has been there for 12 years. (cont)
